creator.description: Like the posts that you would like to be labeled as, 4 labels maximum

locales.description: made by the fermentation of dough using wild lactobacillaceae and yeast. Lactic acid from fermentation imparts a sour taste
locales.name: Sourdough

locales.description: made with various proportions of flour from rye grain. It can be light or dark in colour and is typically denser than bread made from wheat flour
locales.name: Rye

locales.description: made using flour that is partly or entirely milled from whole or almost-whole wheat grains
locales.name: Whole Wheat

locales.description: made from wheat flour from which the bran and the germ layers have been removed from the whole wheat berry as part of the flour grinding process
locales.name: White Bread

locales.description: a pastry of French origin whose high egg and butter content gives it a rich and tender crumb. It has a dark, golden, and flaky crust, frequently accentuated by an egg wash applied after proofing
locales.name: Brioche

locales.description: made of dough from which a small portion has been set aside as an offering. Challah may also refer to the dough offering. The word is biblical in origin, meaning "loaf". Rooted in Jewish tradition
locales.name: Challah

locales.description: a flat leavened oven-baked Italian bread
locales.name: Focaccia

locales.description: a soft white bread commonly sold in Asian bakeries, also known as Hokkaido milk bread
locales.name: Shokupan

locales.description: a leavened, oven-baked flatbread, found in the cuisines of Central Asia, South Asia, Southeast Asia, and the Caribbean
locales.name: Naan

locales.description: made from wheat flour, common in the Mediterranean, Levant, and neighbouring areas
locales.name: Pita

locales.description: a traditional Mexican sweet bread roll with similar consistency to a brioche. Conchas get their name from their round shape and their striped, seashell-like appearance
locales.name: Concha

locales.description: excludes gluten, which is a mixture of prolamin proteins found in wheat, as well as barley, rye, and oats
locales.name: Gluten Free

locales.description: a long, thin type of bread of French origin that is commonly made from basic lean dough (the dough, not the shape, is defined by French law)
locales.name: Baguette
